column4: Daily Bet Boosts At William Hill Novices' Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qual') (GBB)
column20: 11/10 Captain Hugo, 6/4 Taurus Bay, 4/1 Race To Base

column4: Daily Bet Boosts At William Hill Novices' Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qual') (GBB)
column20: 11/10 Captain Hugo, 6/4 Taurus Bay, 4/1 Race To Base
column36: Won on second hurdle start; much tougher task today but can give another good account
column37: Had an experience edge when beating Captain Hugo in a bumper (2m, good); fifth in warm maiden at Uttoxeter (2m, good) on hurdle debut then won easily at 1-5 at Hereford (2m, good); has shown promise on good to soft; this is certainly a tougher assignment but he can give another good account.

column4: Daily Bet Boosts At William Hill Novices' Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qual') (GBB)
column20: 11/10 Captain Hugo, 6/4 Taurus Bay, 4/1 Race To Base
column36: Point winner who made it 2-2 with easy novice hurdle win at Stratford; has to be respected
column37: Bought for £155,000 after winning on debut in Irish maiden point (3m, yielding) in February and made it 2-2 with easy win in novice hurdle at Stratford (2m, good to soft) in October; it remains to be seen where his limitations lie and he has to be respected.

column4: William Hill Each Way Extra Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBBRace)
column20: 7/2 Top Guy, 4/1 Glance Of Glory, 9/2 Princesse Milania, 5/1 Sandscape, 13/2 The Great Escape, 15/2 Dixie Mafia, 12/1 The Clonmel Kid,  Bombay Pete
column36: Very lightly raced 5yo; has got up close home over 2m4f at Worcester on last two starts
column37: All three starts on good ground; won at Worcester (2m4f) in September on second outing and followed up in handicap there (2m4f), getting up close home each time; his dam won at up to 3m1f and this very lightly raced 5yo could continue to progress now up in trip; player if handling the ground.

column4: William Hill Each Way Extra Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBBRace)
column20: 7/2 Top Guy, 4/1 Glance Of Glory, 9/2 Princesse Milania, 5/1 Sandscape, 13/2 The Great Escape, 15/2 Dixie Mafia, 12/1 The Clonmel Kid,  Bombay Pete
column36: Yard is in better form now than when he last raced and he's unexposed at this trip
column37: He needs to produce more than he managed on his two starts in October but his stable is in better form now; placed in 3m points in 2024 and he could have more to offer now back in a handicap and back up in trip.

column4: William Hill Each Way Extra Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBBRace)
column20: 7/2 Top Guy, 4/1 Glance Of Glory, 9/2 Princesse Milania, 5/1 Sandscape, 13/2 The Great Escape, 15/2 Dixie Mafia, 12/1 The Clonmel Kid,  Bombay Pete
column36: Runner-up on handicap debut in July and may have needed last month's first outing since
column37: Tailed off at Warwick (2m5f, good) last month but may have needed that first run since July; back then he was second on his handicap debut at Worcester (2m4f, good) and he's bred to be suited by this step up in trip; has shown promise on good to soft; no surprise if he runs well.

column4: William Hill Each Way Extra Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBBRace)
column20: 7/2 Top Guy, 4/1 Glance Of Glory, 9/2 Princesse Milania, 5/1 Sandscape, 13/2 The Great Escape, 15/2 Dixie Mafia, 12/1 The Clonmel Kid,  Bombay Pete

column4: William Hill Each Way Extra Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBBRace)
column20: 7/2 Top Guy, 4/1 Glance Of Glory, 9/2 Princesse Milania, 5/1 Sandscape, 13/2 The Great Escape, 15/2 Dixie Mafia, 12/1 The Clonmel Kid,  Bombay Pete
column36: Stayed on to go close over 2m4f at Southwell; today's trip could be right up his street
column37: 3m point winner (good to yielding) who left his first two handicap runs miles behind when staying on for neck second at Southwell (2m4f, soft); today's longer trip could be right up his street and he's firmly in calculations.

column4: William Hill Each Way Extra Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBBRace)
column20: 7/2 Top Guy, 4/1 Glance Of Glory, 9/2 Princesse Milania, 5/1 Sandscape, 13/2 The Great Escape, 15/2 Dixie Mafia, 12/1 The Clonmel Kid,  Bombay Pete
column36: 0-8 over hurdles but has run well on last two starts and he's an each-way contender
column37: 0-8 over hurdles and no match for the winner at Market Rasen (2m7f, good/good to soft) on his last two starts, but those were both still good efforts and he's an each-way contender in first-time headgear.

column4: William Hill Each Way Extra Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBBRace)
column20: 7/2 Top Guy, 4/1 Glance Of Glory, 9/2 Princesse Milania, 5/1 Sandscape, 13/2 The Great Escape, 15/2 Dixie Mafia, 12/1 The Clonmel Kid,  Bombay Pete
column36: Third at Catterick in hat-trick bid; can build on that effort at this more galloping track
column37: Won at Plumpton (3m1f, good to soft) in October and followed up on stable debut at Wetherby (2m5f, good) 11 days later; another good run when third at Catterick (3m1f, good) a fortnight ago and there can be optimism she'll build on that performance now back at a more galloping track.

column4: William Hill Each Way Extra Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBBRace)
column20: 7/2 Top Guy, 4/1 Glance Of Glory, 9/2 Princesse Milania, 5/1 Sandscape, 13/2 The Great Escape, 15/2 Dixie Mafia, 12/1 The Clonmel Kid,  Bombay Pete

column4: William Hill Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 9/4 Kdeux Saint Fray, 3/1 Captain Butler, 11/2 Pleasington,  Guard The Moon, 6/1 Inedit Star, 13/2 It's Hard To Know
column36: Close third of five at Wetherby on chase debut and every chance this longer trip will suit
column37: Two-time novice hurdle winner (1m7f/2m, heavy) who was a close third of five on his chase and handicap debut at Wetherby (1m7f, soft) three weeks ago; every chance this longer trip will suit and he's one to consider.

column4: William Hill Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 9/4 Kdeux Saint Fray, 3/1 Captain Butler, 11/2 Pleasington,  Guard The Moon, 6/1 Inedit Star, 13/2 It's Hard To Know
column36: 0-8 over fences but has run some big races and he could be thereabouts
column37: Three wins in France (bumpers/hurdle); 0-8 over fences and takes on some progressive types but he's run well in defeat off this mark on each of his last three starts (2m-2m4f, good to soft/good); could be thereabouts.

column4: William Hill Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 9/4 Kdeux Saint Fray, 3/1 Captain Butler, 11/2 Pleasington,  Guard The Moon, 6/1 Inedit Star, 13/2 It's Hard To Know
column36: Won at Cheltenham on his second chase start and a 3lb rise could be lenient for this 5yo
column37: Point, bumper and maiden hurdle winner (good to soft/good) who fell on chase debut but showed what is capable of when winning at Cheltenham (2m4f, soft) three weeks ago; a 3lb rise could prove lenient for this 5yo.

column4: William Hill Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 9/4 Kdeux Saint Fray, 3/1 Captain Butler, 11/2 Pleasington,  Guard The Moon, 6/1 Inedit Star, 13/2 It's Hard To Know
column36: Some good hurdle form last season and he's one to be interested in on his chase debut
column37: Progressive over hurdles last autumn, including when winning after a break (2m5f, good), and he returned to form at Perth (3m2f, good to soft) in April when disputing the lead when falling two out; this half-brother to smart chaser Potterman is one to be interested in on his chase debut.

column4: William Hill Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 9/4 Kdeux Saint Fray, 3/1 Captain Butler, 11/2 Pleasington,  Guard The Moon, 6/1 Inedit Star, 13/2 It's Hard To Know
column36: Lightly raced 7yo who is open to improvement on this chase debut and second stable start
column37: Point, bumper and maiden hurdle winner (soft-good) who was a clear second when the even-money favourite on his stable and handicap hurdle debut at Ayr (2m4f, soft) last month; this very lightly raced 7yo may well improve both for that outing and today's switch to fences; firmly in calculations.

column4: William Hill Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 9/4 Kdeux Saint Fray, 3/1 Captain Butler, 11/2 Pleasington,  Guard The Moon, 6/1 Inedit Star, 13/2 It's Hard To Know
column36: Good start to hurdling career late last year and could get back on track following a break
column37: Won late last year on first two hurdle starts (2m3f/2m4f, good/good to soft); well beaten in Grade 1 Challow next time and likewise in the EBF Final in March when last seen, but a break may have helped and this point winner retains potential now switched to fences.

column4: William Hill Racing Winnings Boost Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 2/1 The Kalooki Kid, 3/1 Margaret's Legacy, 9/2 Richmond Lake, 6/1 Ned Tanner, 8/1 Uncle Bert, 12/1 Bleu d'Enfer, 16/1 Gaelic Arc
column36: 2 h'cap wins last term; this second-season chaser is in good hands to continue to progress
column37: Won two handicaps in a row last winter (2m3f/2m4f, good to soft) and reappeared with close fourth of four in Listed intermediate chase at Carlisle (2m4f, good to soft), a run he may improve for; this second-season chaser is in good hands to continue to progress.

column4: William Hill Racing Winnings Boost Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 2/1 The Kalooki Kid, 3/1 Margaret's Legacy, 9/2 Richmond Lake, 6/1 Ned Tanner, 8/1 Uncle Bert, 12/1 Bleu d'Enfer, 16/1 Gaelic Arc
column36: On a handy mark and shaped with promise on reappearance; won last running of this in 2023
column37: Last season ended with two below-par runs but he reappeared at Bangor last month following wind surgery and shaped with promise before fading; he may have needed that run and is well treated on last season's best efforts; won the last running of this in 2023 and could play a leading role.

column4: William Hill Racing Winnings Boost Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 2/1 The Kalooki Kid, 3/1 Margaret's Legacy, 9/2 Richmond Lake, 6/1 Ned Tanner, 8/1 Uncle Bert, 12/1 Bleu d'Enfer, 16/1 Gaelic Arc
column36: Yet to threaten over fences but won off this mark over hurdles in January; not ruled out
column37: Failed to threaten last autumn on his three chase starts but his final effort here (3m1f, good) wasn't without promise behind a very well-handicapped winner; won off this mark over hurdles (3m, soft) in January; not ruled out.

column4: William Hill Racing Winnings Boost Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 2/1 The Kalooki Kid, 3/1 Margaret's Legacy, 9/2 Richmond Lake, 6/1 Ned Tanner, 8/1 Uncle Bert, 12/1 Bleu d'Enfer, 16/1 Gaelic Arc
column27: M Richard Venn Bloodstock Ltd & M J W
column36: Has done very well since joining this yard and holds solid claims
column37: Won last winter on his first two starts for this yard (2m4f, good to soft/soft) and good second at Bangor (2m4f, soft) last month on his first outing since, when clear with a rejuvenated winner; solid claims.

column4: William Hill Racing Winnings Boost Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 2/1 The Kalooki Kid, 3/1 Margaret's Legacy, 9/2 Richmond Lake, 6/1 Ned Tanner, 8/1 Uncle Bert, 12/1 Bleu d'Enfer, 16/1 Gaelic Arc
column36: Soundly beaten in Grand Sefton but Brian Hughes remains on board for second stable start
column37: Off the mark at the 12th attempt over fences at Carlisle (2m4f, good) in April on final run for Stuart Crawford; sold for £55,000 in July and versatile ground-wise; soundly beaten in the Grand Sefton here on last month's stable debut but that was a tough ask on his reappearance and Brian Hughes remains on board (trainer also runs Richmond Lake); worth a second look.

column4: William Hill Racing Winnings Boost Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 2/1 The Kalooki Kid, 3/1 Margaret's Legacy, 9/2 Richmond Lake, 6/1 Ned Tanner, 8/1 Uncle Bert, 12/1 Bleu d'Enfer, 16/1 Gaelic Arc
column32: Mark R D Fleming / T Westropp Bennett
column36: Irish challenger; well treated on his best form this summer but has gone off the boil
column37: Irish challenger who is well handicapped on his best form this summer and is one to watch in the betting; however, he's gone off the boil more recently and needs to turn things around.

column4: William Hill Racing Winnings Boost Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 2/1 The Kalooki Kid, 3/1 Margaret's Legacy, 9/2 Richmond Lake, 6/1 Ned Tanner, 8/1 Uncle Bert, 12/1 Bleu d'Enfer, 16/1 Gaelic Arc
column36: May have needed reappearance run; won twice last season and might not be far away
column37: Tailed off on reappearance at Kelso four weeks ago but may have needed the run; won twice last season (2m4f, soft) and might not be far away.

column4: William Hill Best Odds Guaranteed Wirral Juvenile Hurdle (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
column20: 6/4 Treasure Planet, 9/4 Edelak, 4/1 Bibe Mus, 10/1 Scarlet Moon, 11/1 Lord, 25/1 Diamond Jim,  Only One Blue
column36: Irish challenger who has shown solid form on both starts and is entitled to respect
column37: French Flat winner (very soft) who won on his hurdle debut at Gowran (2m, yielding) in October then finished third of five at Down Royal (2m1f, yielding) behind subsequent Grade 3 winner Mange Tout; he's travelled from Ireland and is entitled to respect.

column4: William Hill Best Odds Guaranteed Wirral Juvenile Hurdle (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
column20: 6/4 Treasure Planet, 9/4 Edelak, 4/1 Bibe Mus, 10/1 Scarlet Moon, 11/1 Lord, 25/1 Diamond Jim,  Only One Blue
column36: Promise when second on last month's debut at Bangor; improvement necessary, but possible
column37: 13-2 when clear second on debut at Bangor (2m, soft) last month and the winner again had plenty in hand at Wincanton on Thursday when making it 2-2; improvement necessary in today's company but that's entirely possible.

column4: William Hill Best Odds Guaranteed Wirral Juvenile Hurdle (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
column20: 6/4 Treasure Planet, 9/4 Edelak, 4/1 Bibe Mus, 10/1 Scarlet Moon, 11/1 Lord, 25/1 Diamond Jim,  Only One Blue
column27: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
column36: Irish Flat winner who brings considerable potential to this first hurdle/stable start
column37: Off the mark at the sixth attempt on the Flat for Johnny Murtagh when wearing first-time tongue-tie and blinkers in Galway maiden (1m4f, yielding to soft) in July; no headgear for this stable/hurdle debut and Tristan Durrell can't claim his usual 3lb, but he brings lots of potential for his top yard.

column4: William Hill Best Odds Guaranteed Wirral Juvenile Hurdle (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
column20: 6/4 Treasure Planet, 9/4 Edelak, 4/1 Bibe Mus, 10/1 Scarlet Moon, 11/1 Lord, 25/1 Diamond Jim,  Only One Blue
column36: Three-time juvenile hurdle winner; heavy ground may not have suited in Cheltenham Grade 2
column37: Won three juvenile hurdles in a row for Olly Murphy in August/September (good to soft/good) before £70,000 sale; heavy ground may not have suited on stable debut in Cheltenham Grade 2 three weeks ago and he could go well.

column4: William Hill Best Odds Guaranteed Wirral Juvenile Hurdle (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
column20: 6/4 Treasure Planet, 9/4 Edelak, 4/1 Bibe Mus, 10/1 Scarlet Moon, 11/1 Lord, 25/1 Diamond Jim,  Only One Blue
column36: Won in good style at Warwick last month on second hurdle start; could be a contender
column37: Progressive on the Flat and won in good style at Warwick (2m, good) last month on second hurdle start; showed some promise on soft ground on the Flat; open to further improvement in this code and could be a contender.

column4: William Hill Best Odds Guaranteed Wirral Juvenile Hurdle (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
column20: 6/4 Treasure Planet, 9/4 Edelak, 4/1 Bibe Mus, 10/1 Scarlet Moon, 11/1 Lord, 25/1 Diamond Jim,  Only One Blue
column36: Won easily at Ludlow last month on second hurdle start and could be a player today
column37: Considerable promise on both Flat starts in Ireland (including on yielding ground; unraced on softer) and he improved for October's hurdle debut to win easily at Ludlow (2m, good) last month; could be a player today.

column4: William Hill Best Odds Guaranteed Wirral Juvenile Hurdle (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
column20: 6/4 Treasure Planet, 9/4 Edelak, 4/1 Bibe Mus, 10/1 Scarlet Moon, 11/1 Lord, 25/1 Diamond Jim,  Only One Blue
column36: Encouraging start to hurdling career but probably vulnerable now up in grade
column37: Fair maiden on the Flat for Richard Hannon; won in first-time cheekpieces (retained since) on hurdle/stable debut at Sedgefield (2m1f, good) in October and runner-up at Hereford (2m, good) since; however, this filly is probably vulnerable up in grade and Tom Broughton can't claim his usual 5lb.

column4: William Hill Half A Mill Becher Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
column20: 9/2 Mr Vango, 11/2 Gaboriot, 6/1 Galia Des Liteaux, 7/1 Bioluminescence,  White Rhino, 8/1 Bill Baxter,  Westerninthepark, 11/1 Excello, 14/1 Monbeg Genius, 16/1 Val Dancer, 25/1 Twig, 28/1 Mahons Glory, 33/1 Roi Mage
column36: Rain will help and this plucky front-runner can dig deep again to find more improvement
column37: Lightly raced 9yo who won the 4m2f Midlands National at Uttoxeter (good to soft) in March when last seen, but that followed another major win over 3m1f at Haydock (soft); raised another 9lb but rain will help and this plucky front-runner can dig deep again to find more improvement; big shout.

column4: William Hill Half A Mill Becher Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
column20: 9/2 Mr Vango, 11/2 Gaboriot, 6/1 Galia Des Liteaux, 7/1 Bioluminescence,  White Rhino, 8/1 Bill Baxter,  Westerninthepark, 11/1 Excello, 14/1 Monbeg Genius, 16/1 Val Dancer, 25/1 Twig, 28/1 Mahons Glory, 33/1 Roi Mage
column36: Lightly raced 7yo who jumps well and probably remains capable of better for Gavin Cromwell
column37: Won a Grade 3 novice hurdle and Grade 2 novice chase, both about 2m6f at Limerick against her own sex, and also a good second in January over 3m1f on heavy; never figured when 9-1 in the Irish National (early interference didn't help) and below form over 2m5f on reappearance one month ago, but this lightly raced 7yo jumps well and probably remains capable of better.

column4: William Hill Half A Mill Becher Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
column20: 9/2 Mr Vango, 11/2 Gaboriot, 6/1 Galia Des Liteaux, 7/1 Bioluminescence,  White Rhino, 8/1 Bill Baxter,  Westerninthepark, 11/1 Excello, 14/1 Monbeg Genius, 16/1 Val Dancer, 25/1 Twig, 28/1 Mahons Glory, 33/1 Roi Mage
column36: Mostly competitive last term but he was behind from the word go here in the Grand National
column37: Dictated the pace for a Uttoxeter win (3m, soft; 2lb higher today) in February in a less demanding race than he's often appeared in; managed fourth in last season's Welsh National and front-running sixth in the bet365 at Sandown, but behind from the word go in the Grand National over these fences and that performance has to be disconcerting.

column4: William Hill Half A Mill Becher Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
column20: 9/2 Mr Vango, 11/2 Gaboriot, 6/1 Galia Des Liteaux, 7/1 Bioluminescence,  White Rhino, 8/1 Bill Baxter,  Westerninthepark, 11/1 Excello, 14/1 Monbeg Genius, 16/1 Val Dancer, 25/1 Twig, 28/1 Mahons Glory, 33/1 Roi Mage
column36: Mixed messages; won last month but tenth in the Grand National in April was a remote one
column37: Ridden by Beau Morgan since 2022; his tenth in the Grand National was a remote one, always behind, and clearly his best effort last term was first time out; back to form with a win at Sandown on reappearance this time round, narrowly in a four-runner race, but he was also a fine second at the 2024 Cheltenham Festival (3m1f, heavy) to show big-race aptitude.

column4: William Hill Half A Mill Becher Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
column20: 9/2 Mr Vango, 11/2 Gaboriot, 6/1 Galia Des Liteaux, 7/1 Bioluminescence,  White Rhino, 8/1 Bill Baxter,  Westerninthepark, 11/1 Excello, 14/1 Monbeg Genius, 16/1 Val Dancer, 25/1 Twig, 28/1 Mahons Glory, 33/1 Roi Mage
column36: 2m5f winner over these fences in 2023; there's been a revival in his fortunes this season
column37: Took the Topham (2m5f, soft) over these fences in April 2023; largely disappointing since but the tide turned with a win at the Punchestown festival (3m, yielding) in May and last month's bold show from the front was his best hurdles form; not proven over this quite this far but he's back in the mix.

column4: William Hill Half A Mill Becher Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
column20: 9/2 Mr Vango, 11/2 Gaboriot, 6/1 Galia Des Liteaux, 7/1 Bioluminescence,  White Rhino, 8/1 Bill Baxter,  Westerninthepark, 11/1 Excello, 14/1 Monbeg Genius, 16/1 Val Dancer, 25/1 Twig, 28/1 Mahons Glory, 33/1 Roi Mage
column32: D G Pryde & D P Van Der Hoeven & G McGladery & J Beaumont
column36: Another French win last time out; 7th and 9th in Grand Nationals and this trip might help
column37: Veteran who won 3m6f Listed cross-country race at Craon in September 2024 and 2025, taking his tally over French fences to ten wins (also one in Ireland); faded from two out when seventh here in the 2023 Grand National and did not jump so fluently when ninth in it in 2024; this shorter trip might help and he's considered each-way.

column4: William Hill Half A Mill Becher Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
column20: 9/2 Mr Vango, 11/2 Gaboriot, 6/1 Galia Des Liteaux, 7/1 Bioluminescence,  White Rhino, 8/1 Bill Baxter,  Westerninthepark, 11/1 Excello, 14/1 Monbeg Genius, 16/1 Val Dancer, 25/1 Twig, 28/1 Mahons Glory, 33/1 Roi Mage
column36: Jumped too ponderously here on reappearance but there were signs of warming to his task
column37: Made a very promising start to his chasing career with two wins late last year; problems in his three starts since, jumping too ponderously on reappearance over these fences four weeks ago but there were signs of him warming to his task; a more competitive display may well be forthcoming today but he's not proved himself beyond 3m.

column4: William Hill Half A Mill Becher Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
column20: 9/2 Mr Vango, 11/2 Gaboriot, 6/1 Galia Des Liteaux, 7/1 Bioluminescence,  White Rhino, 8/1 Bill Baxter,  Westerninthepark, 11/1 Excello, 14/1 Monbeg Genius, 16/1 Val Dancer, 25/1 Twig, 28/1 Mahons Glory, 33/1 Roi Mage
column36: 8th in the 2024 Grand National off 12lb higher; needs respect for top yard
column37: Led soon after four out to two out when eighth here in the 2024 Grand National; disappointing last term after her Welsh National fifth but reappearance five weeks ago was a step back in the right direction and, off 12lb lower today than her peak mark, she needs respect for yard which has already grabbed plenty of success in top chase events this season.

column4: William Hill Half A Mill Becher Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
column20: 9/2 Mr Vango, 11/2 Gaboriot, 6/1 Galia Des Liteaux, 7/1 Bioluminescence,  White Rhino, 8/1 Bill Baxter,  Westerninthepark, 11/1 Excello, 14/1 Monbeg Genius, 16/1 Val Dancer, 25/1 Twig, 28/1 Mahons Glory, 33/1 Roi Mage
column32: C Nightingale & Hold My Beer Partnership
column36: Showed plenty of dash up front when 4th of 17 in the 2m5f Grand Sefton over these fences
column37: Has run with credit virtually every time since joining this yard last winter; showed plenty of dash up front when fourth of 17 in the 2m5f Grand Sefton over these fences on latest outing but there's much more for him to prove on worse than good to soft and over 3m+.

column4: William Hill Half A Mill Becher Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
column20: 9/2 Mr Vango, 11/2 Gaboriot, 6/1 Galia Des Liteaux, 7/1 Bioluminescence,  White Rhino, 8/1 Bill Baxter,  Westerninthepark, 11/1 Excello, 14/1 Monbeg Genius, 16/1 Val Dancer, 25/1 Twig, 28/1 Mahons Glory, 33/1 Roi Mage
column36: 3rd of 17 in 2m5f Grand Sefton here was his best show for ages; stamina can be questioned
column37: No win since 2023 but he was bang there when making a bad mistake two out in the Topham here in April and last month's second attempt over these fences when third of 17 in the Grand Sefton (again 2m5f) was his best show for ages; back in the picture but his stamina at about 3m can be questioned.

column4: William Hill Half A Mill Becher Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
column20: 9/2 Mr Vango, 11/2 Gaboriot, 6/1 Galia Des Liteaux, 7/1 Bioluminescence,  White Rhino, 8/1 Bill Baxter,  Westerninthepark, 11/1 Excello, 14/1 Monbeg Genius, 16/1 Val Dancer, 25/1 Twig, 28/1 Mahons Glory, 33/1 Roi Mage
column36: Disputed lead at final fence when respectable fourth over 3m2f at Carlisle five weeks ago
column37: Mostly ran well in 2m4f-2m6f handicaps on varied ground as a novice last term before barely sighted when 16-1 for the 3m2f Kim Muir at Cheltenham; disputed the lead over the final fence when a respectable fourth over 3m2f at Carlisle five weeks ago, giving more hope that he will stay this trip although he clearly needs to see it out better.

column4: William Hill Half A Mill Becher Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
column20: 9/2 Mr Vango, 11/2 Gaboriot, 6/1 Galia Des Liteaux, 7/1 Bioluminescence,  White Rhino, 8/1 Bill Baxter,  Westerninthepark, 11/1 Excello, 14/1 Monbeg Genius, 16/1 Val Dancer, 25/1 Twig, 28/1 Mahons Glory, 33/1 Roi Mage
column36: Probably needed the race last month and a leading player judged on last season's exploits
column37: Won at Carlisle first time out last season before his Welsh National win (3m6f, soft) and a promoted second in the Grand National Trial at Haydock; last of nine in the same Carlisle race on reappearance this term but he wasn't far away two out, probably needing the race, and is a leading player judged on last season's exploits.

column4: William Hill Half A Mill Becher Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
column20: 9/2 Mr Vango, 11/2 Gaboriot, 6/1 Galia Des Liteaux, 7/1 Bioluminescence,  White Rhino, 8/1 Bill Baxter,  Westerninthepark, 11/1 Excello, 14/1 Monbeg Genius, 16/1 Val Dancer, 25/1 Twig, 28/1 Mahons Glory, 33/1 Roi Mage
column36: 4m winner as a hunter chaser and placed in the last two Grand Seftons over these fences
column37: Third in the 2m5f Grand Sefton over these fences last November and runner-up in it this term; failure to match that subsequently last season is a worry, but he registered a 4m win on soft at Cheltenham as a hunter chaser, so stamina is not a problem and he has to be in serious calculations.

column4: New William Hill Racing Bet Builder Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Bear Market, 9/2 Rambo T,  Wellington Arch, 11/2 Act Of Authority, 6/1 Rubber Ball, 9/1 Sunray Shadow, 14/1 Cracking Rhapsody,  Stream Of Stars,  Kepler's Law, 20/1 Brewin'upastorm
column36: Three-time Grade 2 winner but this 12yo has been absent since April 2024
column37: Three-time Grade 2 hurdle winner who is well treated on peak form; however, this 12yo is unraced since April 2024 and it remains to be seen how much ability he retains; one of three for the yard; watch the betting.

column4: New William Hill Racing Bet Builder Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Bear Market, 9/2 Rambo T,  Wellington Arch, 11/2 Act Of Authority, 6/1 Rubber Ball, 9/1 Sunray Shadow, 14/1 Cracking Rhapsody,  Stream Of Stars,  Kepler's Law, 20/1 Brewin'upastorm
column36: 8yo who was better than ever when winning at Chepstow and that form has been franked
column37: 8yo who looked better than ever when winning a competitive handicap at Chepstow (2m3f, good) in October following a break; has also won on soft/good to soft; the Chepstow form has been franked and he's respected up 6lb.

column4: New William Hill Racing Bet Builder Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Bear Market, 9/2 Rambo T,  Wellington Arch, 11/2 Act Of Authority, 6/1 Rubber Ball, 9/1 Sunray Shadow, 14/1 Cracking Rhapsody,  Stream Of Stars,  Kepler's Law, 20/1 Brewin'upastorm
column32: J D Wright & Mrs S Wright
column36: Two major handicap wins in Scotland in the spring; well beaten on reappearance; new trip
column37: Won two major handicaps in Scotland in the spring (2m, good to soft; has also won on soft); he may have needed last month's reappearance at Cheltenham but was beaten a long way, and he's untested at this trip.

column4: New William Hill Racing Bet Builder Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Bear Market, 9/2 Rambo T,  Wellington Arch, 11/2 Act Of Authority, 6/1 Rubber Ball, 9/1 Sunray Shadow, 14/1 Cracking Rhapsody,  Stream Of Stars,  Kepler's Law, 20/1 Brewin'upastorm
column36: Runner-up at the Cheltenham Festival in March and could build on last month's comeback run
column37: Two wins under Lewis Saunders last November (2m4f/2m3f, good to soft/good) and runner-up in the Martin Pipe at Cheltenham (2m4f, good to soft) in March; ran okay on return at Newbury last month; could build on that.

column4: New William Hill Racing Bet Builder Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Bear Market, 9/2 Rambo T,  Wellington Arch, 11/2 Act Of Authority, 6/1 Rubber Ball, 9/1 Sunray Shadow, 14/1 Cracking Rhapsody,  Stream Of Stars,  Kepler's Law, 20/1 Brewin'upastorm
column36: Won big-field C&D handicap in April and could be set for another productive campaign
column37: Two novice hurdle wins last season (soft/good to soft) and he landed a big-field handicap over this C&D (good to soft) at the Grand National meeting, before a creditable third at Punchestown in May; this unexposed 6yo could be set for another productive campaign.

column4: New William Hill Racing Bet Builder Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Bear Market, 9/2 Rambo T,  Wellington Arch, 11/2 Act Of Authority, 6/1 Rubber Ball, 9/1 Sunray Shadow, 14/1 Cracking Rhapsody,  Stream Of Stars,  Kepler's Law, 20/1 Brewin'upastorm
column36: 10yo who looked as good as ever when second at Plumpton and might not be far away
column37: 10yo who won at Bangor (2m, good) in May and looked as good as ever when runner-up at Plumpton (2m4f, good) last month following a break; has also won on good to soft; might not be far away.

column4: New William Hill Racing Bet Builder Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Bear Market, 9/2 Rambo T,  Wellington Arch, 11/2 Act Of Authority, 6/1 Rubber Ball, 9/1 Sunray Shadow, 14/1 Cracking Rhapsody,  Stream Of Stars,  Kepler's Law, 20/1 Brewin'upastorm
column36: Tailed off in the Greatwood but he's a player if tapping back into last season's promise
column37: Tailed off in Grade 1 novice hurdle here in April and same story in the Greatwood at Cheltenham last month on reappearance; however, he won two novice hurdles early this year (2m, good to soft/soft), shaping as though this trip could suit, and he's a player if tapping back into that promise.

column4: New William Hill Racing Bet Builder Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Bear Market, 9/2 Rambo T,  Wellington Arch, 11/2 Act Of Authority, 6/1 Rubber Ball, 9/1 Sunray Shadow, 14/1 Cracking Rhapsody,  Stream Of Stars,  Kepler's Law, 20/1 Brewin'upastorm
column27: C R R Sweeting & Conduit Farm Stud
column36: Well beaten in March on final run for Laura Morgan same outcome on both runs for this yard
column37: Point/novice hurdle winner who remains lightly raced and is one to watch in the betting; however, he was well beaten in March on his final run for Laura Morgan and it's been the same outcome on both runs for this yard.

column4: New William Hill Racing Bet Builder Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Bear Market, 9/2 Rambo T,  Wellington Arch, 11/2 Act Of Authority, 6/1 Rubber Ball, 9/1 Sunray Shadow, 14/1 Cracking Rhapsody,  Stream Of Stars,  Kepler's Law, 20/1 Brewin'upastorm
column36: 2-2 at Aintree and in the tongue-tie; won on handicap debut at Southwell; strong claims
column37: Course bumper winner who landed novice hurdle here (2m1f, good) in May on final run for Nicky Henderson, and made it 2-2 in this tongue-tie when scoring on handicap debut at Southwell (2m4f, soft; first run for Mel Rowley) last month; unexposed and could well maintain his unbeaten Aintree record.

column4: New William Hill Racing Bet Builder Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Bear Market, 9/2 Rambo T,  Wellington Arch, 11/2 Act Of Authority, 6/1 Rubber Ball, 9/1 Sunray Shadow, 14/1 Cracking Rhapsody,  Stream Of Stars,  Kepler's Law, 20/1 Brewin'upastorm
column32: S T Racing - The Founders' Syndicate
column36: Lightly raced 6yo who retains potential for top yard, especially now back up in trip
column37: Won a C&D maiden (good) last October on his second hurdle start; soundly beaten fifth on handicap debut at Newbury (2m, good to soft) last month and 2lb wrong at the weights today, but he may have needed that latest run and he retains potential for his top yard, especially now back up in trip.

column4: Coral Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/6 The Price Of Peace, 4/1 Ignore The Door, 5/1 Watchful Protector, 12/1 Times Are Green,  Aaron, 33/1 Arctic Conditions, 40/1 Order In The House, 50/1 The Moonlight Man
column36: Irish point win; also took a novice at Worcester (2m7f, good; tongue tied) in October
column37: Fourth attempt when he won an Irish point (yielding to soft) but first under rules when he took a seven-runner novice hurdle at Worcester (2m7f, good; tongue tied) in October; that's not the best form in this line-up but he has clear potential.

column4: Coral Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/6 The Price Of Peace, 4/1 Ignore The Door, 5/1 Watchful Protector, 12/1 Times Are Green,  Aaron, 33/1 Arctic Conditions, 40/1 Order In The House, 50/1 The Moonlight Man
column36: Left E Mullins for 20,000euros in November; very mixed messages for him included 2m3f win
column37: Some heavy defeats in Ireland but he won a Tipperary maiden hurdle (2m3f, good to yielding) by 6l in October; tailed off on handicap debut at Cheltenham (3m, good) latest and left Emmett Mullins for 20,000euros in early November; very mixed messages.

column4: Coral Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/6 The Price Of Peace, 4/1 Ignore The Door, 5/1 Watchful Protector, 12/1 Times Are Green,  Aaron, 33/1 Arctic Conditions, 40/1 Order In The House, 50/1 The Moonlight Man
column36: Soundly beaten in a bumper at Exeter (favourite) and maiden hurdle at Aintree (50-1)
column37: In command when unseating at the final fence on debut in Irish maiden point (3m, heavy) in March 2024; however, he was a soundly beaten when favourite in a bumper at Exeter (2m, soft) this January and when 50-1 in a maiden hurdle at Aintree (2m4f, good to soft) in October.

column4: Coral Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/6 The Price Of Peace, 4/1 Ignore The Door, 5/1 Watchful Protector, 12/1 Times Are Green,  Aaron, 33/1 Arctic Conditions, 40/1 Order In The House, 50/1 The Moonlight Man
column36: Half-brother to jumps winners Deploy The Getaway (fairly useful) and Stellar Stream
column37: Sixth foal; half-brother to winners Deploy The Getaway (point/2m hurdle) and Stellar Stream (point/3m2f hurdle/3m6f chase); dam unraced half-sister to 3m/3m6f chase winner Bally Braes; on debut, others preferred.

column4: Coral Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/6 The Price Of Peace, 4/1 Ignore The Door, 5/1 Watchful Protector, 12/1 Times Are Green,  Aaron, 33/1 Arctic Conditions, 40/1 Order In The House, 50/1 The Moonlight Man
column36: Irish point winner who failed to show much at 200-1 in a warm 2m4f maiden hurdle here
column37: Narrow winner of an Irish maiden point (soft to heavy) in January; however, he was 200-1 and failed to show much in a warm maiden hurdle here (2m4f, good to soft) one month ago.

column4: Coral Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/6 The Price Of Peace, 4/1 Ignore The Door, 5/1 Watchful Protector, 12/1 Times Are Green,  Aaron, 33/1 Arctic Conditions, 40/1 Order In The House, 50/1 The Moonlight Man
column36: Irish point winner and a lot to like about his 2nd in Ffos Las maiden hurdle (2m4f, soft)
column37: Off the mark in Irish maiden points at third attempt, by a wide margin on soft ground in March; 7-1 for rules debut in maiden hurdle at Ffos Las (2m4f, soft) in October and kept on well to be second of 12, form which has been boosted, including when the fourth and winner dominated a race at Newbury last Saturday; there was a lot to like in that performance.

column4: Coral Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/6 The Price Of Peace, 4/1 Ignore The Door, 5/1 Watchful Protector, 12/1 Times Are Green,  Aaron, 33/1 Arctic Conditions, 40/1 Order In The House, 50/1 The Moonlight Man
column36: Promise in bumpers last term but hurdling debut (11-2) this season brought a heavy defeat
column37: Displayed promise in all three bumpers last season, but hurdling debut in a novice at Uttoxeter (2m4f, good to soft; 11-2) five weeks ago brought a heavy defeat; early days but others have more pressing claims.

column4: Coral Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/6 The Price Of Peace, 4/1 Ignore The Door, 5/1 Watchful Protector, 12/1 Times Are Green,  Aaron, 33/1 Arctic Conditions, 40/1 Order In The House, 50/1 The Moonlight Man
column36: Others have accomplished more as hurdler and he's probably best watched until handicapping
column37: 0-6 on the Flat in France last year but had one close call; promise over hurdles at Cartmel (2m1f, heavy; for Stuart Edmunds) in August 2024 and Ffos Las (2m4f, soft; for new yard) in October but others have accomplished more and he's probably best watched until going handicapping.

column4: Protectorcomms Sirens And Stallions Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 2/1 Ben Solo, 9/2 Just Over Land, 11/2 Lunar Discovery, 7/1 Lumi Plugin, 8/1 Tune In A Box,  Bonza Boy, 12/1 Happy And Fine, 14/1 Starcrossed Lover
column36: Promising novice hurdler last season; last of five on chase debut but can do better here
column37: Impressed when winning two 2m novice hurdles last winter (good to soft/soft); not much has gone to plan since but positives can be drawn from last month's chase/handicap debut at Wetherby (1m7f, soft), even though he was last of five; up in trip today and could still have potential.

column4: Protectorcomms Sirens And Stallions Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 2/1 Ben Solo, 9/2 Just Over Land, 11/2 Lunar Discovery, 7/1 Lumi Plugin, 8/1 Tune In A Box,  Bonza Boy, 12/1 Happy And Fine, 14/1 Starcrossed Lover
column36: 4-14 over hurdles; never really looked dangerous on chase debut; might come on for the run
column37: 4-14 over hurdles; held up in rear and never really looked dangerous on chase debut at Ffos Las (2m3f, soft) in October but that run, his first since May, might have brought him on and his current mark is workable.

column4: Protectorcomms Sirens And Stallions Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 2/1 Ben Solo, 9/2 Just Over Land, 11/2 Lunar Discovery, 7/1 Lumi Plugin, 8/1 Tune In A Box,  Bonza Boy, 12/1 Happy And Fine, 14/1 Starcrossed Lover
column36: Made all over C&D a fortnight ago on just his second chase start; obvious contender
column37: Bettered low-key seasonal/chase debut when making all over C&D (good to soft) a fortnight ago; 6lb higher here but could easily have more to offer over fences; leading contender.

column4: Protectorcomms Sirens And Stallions Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 2/1 Ben Solo, 9/2 Just Over Land, 11/2 Lunar Discovery, 7/1 Lumi Plugin, 8/1 Tune In A Box,  Bonza Boy, 12/1 Happy And Fine, 14/1 Starcrossed Lover
column27: Mrs P Souverain & Mr A De Boisbrunet
column32: L Cross, S Cross & J Fitzpatrick
column36: Seemed to be going okay before falling at Aintree last month; could have a say
column37: Ended last season's light campaign with a disappointing effort but seemed to be going okay before falling at fourth-last fence on Grand National course at Aintree last month and has possibilities here.

column4: Protectorcomms Sirens And Stallions Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 2/1 Ben Solo, 9/2 Just Over Land, 11/2 Lunar Discovery, 7/1 Lumi Plugin, 8/1 Tune In A Box,  Bonza Boy, 12/1 Happy And Fine, 14/1 Starcrossed Lover
column36: 0-8 over fences but kept on for third over 2m last month and this longer trip will suit
column37: 0-8 over fences but kept on for very respectable third in mares' chase at Uttoxeter (2m, heavy) three weeks ago and is sure to be suited by today's move back up in trip; each-way claims at least.

column4: Protectorcomms Sirens And Stallions Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 2/1 Ben Solo, 9/2 Just Over Land, 11/2 Lunar Discovery, 7/1 Lumi Plugin, 8/1 Tune In A Box,  Bonza Boy, 12/1 Happy And Fine, 14/1 Starcrossed Lover
column32: J Hinds, A Head & G L Moore
column36: Ended last season in good form over hurdles; makes chasing debut after eight-month break
column37: Came good over hurdles at Plumpton (2m4f, good) in March and probably bettered that form when close second at Warwick (2m3f, good) the following month; makes chasing debut after eight-month break but will be fine on the slower ground; market may guide.

column4: Protectorcomms Sirens And Stallions Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 2/1 Ben Solo, 9/2 Just Over Land, 11/2 Lunar Discovery, 7/1 Lumi Plugin, 8/1 Tune In A Box,  Bonza Boy, 12/1 Happy And Fine, 14/1 Starcrossed Lover
column27: M Collet, J Collet & M Collet
column36: Rallied on run-in to win four-runner Fontwell chase last month; 4lb rise is manageable
column37: Rallied well on run-in to win four-runner chase on seasonal debut at Fontwell (2m3f, good to soft) three weeks ago, his sixth start over fences; still on a workable mark after recent 4lb rise and enters cacuations.

column4: Protectorcomms Sirens And Stallions Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 2/1 Ben Solo, 9/2 Just Over Land, 11/2 Lunar Discovery, 7/1 Lumi Plugin, 8/1 Tune In A Box,  Bonza Boy, 12/1 Happy And Fine, 14/1 Starcrossed Lover
column36: Returned to form with good second at Exeter in February; not seen since
column37: 2-10 over fences, the latter win over C&D; returned to form with very creditable second at Exeter (2m3f, good to soft) in February but has fitness to prove after ten-month absence.

column4: Happy 21st Birthday Lori Garrett Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Stayers Hurdle Series Qualifier)
column20: 11/4 Pyleigh Master, 5/1 Idefix De Ciergues,  Getalead, 7/1 Love Of Neymore, 8/1 Kayf Dancer,  Jena d'Oudairies, 10/1 Queens Venture, 12/1 Champagne Chic, 25/1 Surrey Quest,  Classic Concorde, 33/1 Road Senam
column36: Very useful marathon chaser on his day; well beaten in two hurdle races this season
column37: Very useful marathon chaser on his day but returned from break with two heavy defeats over hurdles in October (2m7f/3m) and needs a huge boost from the refitted cheekpieces here.

column4: Happy 21st Birthday Lori Garrett Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Stayers Hurdle Series Qualifier)
column20: 11/4 Pyleigh Master, 5/1 Idefix De Ciergues,  Getalead, 7/1 Love Of Neymore, 8/1 Kayf Dancer,  Jena d'Oudairies, 10/1 Queens Venture, 12/1 Champagne Chic, 25/1 Surrey Quest,  Classic Concorde, 33/1 Road Senam
column36: Finished rather weakly when favourite for handicap debut but remains unexposed
column37: Unexposed 7yo who easily won three-runner maiden at Exeter (2m5f, good to firm) in March; finished rather weakly when favourite for handicap debut at Newton Abbot (2m5f, good to soft) in October but it would be dangerous to write him off after that run.

column4: Happy 21st Birthday Lori Garrett Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Stayers Hurdle Series Qualifier)
column20: 11/4 Pyleigh Master, 5/1 Idefix De Ciergues,  Getalead, 7/1 Love Of Neymore, 8/1 Kayf Dancer,  Jena d'Oudairies, 10/1 Queens Venture, 12/1 Champagne Chic, 25/1 Surrey Quest,  Classic Concorde, 33/1 Road Senam
column36: Suited by this C&D but long in the tooth now and far too inconsistent to rely upon
column37: Veteran who gained the last two of his seven hurrdle wins over C&D (soft/heavy); far too inconsistent to rely upon now, though, and was well beaten here on seasonal debut in October.

column4: Happy 21st Birthday Lori Garrett Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Stayers Hurdle Series Qualifier)
column20: 11/4 Pyleigh Master, 5/1 Idefix De Ciergues,  Getalead, 7/1 Love Of Neymore, 8/1 Kayf Dancer,  Jena d'Oudairies, 10/1 Queens Venture, 12/1 Champagne Chic, 25/1 Surrey Quest,  Classic Concorde, 33/1 Road Senam
column36: Ran well for a long way before weakening into third on stable debut; bit more needed here
column37: Signed off Dan Skelton with two wins this summer (2m6f/2m5f) and ran well for a long way before weakening into third on recent stable debut at Newcastle (2m7f, good to soft); needs to find extra here, though.

column4: Happy 21st Birthday Lori Garrett Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Stayers Hurdle Series Qualifier)
column20: 11/4 Pyleigh Master, 5/1 Idefix De Ciergues,  Getalead, 7/1 Love Of Neymore, 8/1 Kayf Dancer,  Jena d'Oudairies, 10/1 Queens Venture, 12/1 Champagne Chic, 25/1 Surrey Quest,  Classic Concorde, 33/1 Road Senam
column36: Made all in 2m4f maiden in April; up in trip for seasonal/handicap debut
column37: Very lightly raced 6yo who made all under regular partner Ella Herbison in Ffos Las maiden (2m4f, soft) in April; makes handicap debut after eight-month absence but his winning form has been well advertised by the placed horses since and he's open to more improvement over this new trip.

column4: Happy 21st Birthday Lori Garrett Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Stayers Hurdle Series Qualifier)
column20: 11/4 Pyleigh Master, 5/1 Idefix De Ciergues,  Getalead, 7/1 Love Of Neymore, 8/1 Kayf Dancer,  Jena d'Oudairies, 10/1 Queens Venture, 12/1 Champagne Chic, 25/1 Surrey Quest,  Classic Concorde, 33/1 Road Senam
column36: Slightly disappointing last time but placed over C&D on seasonal debut; each-way claims
column37: Slightly disappointing when fourth at Bangor last time but gave good account when placed over C&D (good) on seasonal debut and, with Jamie Brace claiming 5lb, he has pretty solid each-way claims.

column4: Happy 21st Birthday Lori Garrett Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Stayers Hurdle Series Qualifier)
column20: 11/4 Pyleigh Master, 5/1 Idefix De Ciergues,  Getalead, 7/1 Love Of Neymore, 8/1 Kayf Dancer,  Jena d'Oudairies, 10/1 Queens Venture, 12/1 Champagne Chic, 25/1 Surrey Quest,  Classic Concorde, 33/1 Road Senam
column36: Unlucky to be hampered when fourth at Kempton recently and remains on a workable mark
column37: Returned from break with two good efforts last month and was unlucky to be hampered by penultimate-flight faller when fourth at Kempton (3m, good) on latter occassion; remains on workable mark and can make his presence felt.

column4: Happy 21st Birthday Lori Garrett Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Stayers Hurdle Series Qualifier)
column20: 11/4 Pyleigh Master, 5/1 Idefix De Ciergues,  Getalead, 7/1 Love Of Neymore, 8/1 Kayf Dancer,  Jena d'Oudairies, 10/1 Queens Venture, 12/1 Champagne Chic, 25/1 Surrey Quest,  Classic Concorde, 33/1 Road Senam
column36: Not disgraced when upped to 2m7f for seasonal debut and remains lightly raced
column37: Well beaten over 2m on handicap debut in the spring but wasn't disgraced when upped to 2m7f and fitted with cheekpieces for last month's reappearance outing; not out of this if that outing brought him on.

column4: Happy 21st Birthday Lori Garrett Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Stayers Hurdle Series Qualifier)
column20: 11/4 Pyleigh Master, 5/1 Idefix De Ciergues,  Getalead, 7/1 Love Of Neymore, 8/1 Kayf Dancer,  Jena d'Oudairies, 10/1 Queens Venture, 12/1 Champagne Chic, 25/1 Surrey Quest,  Classic Concorde, 33/1 Road Senam
column36: Front-runner; placed over C&D in February and ran okay last month, after a break
column37: Front-runner who won at Wincanton (2m4f, good to soft) last December and was placed over C&D (soft) in February; may not have been ideally suited by good ground when making satisfactory seasonal debut last month; no surprise if she gives this a good shot.

column4: Happy 21st Birthday Lori Garrett Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Stayers Hurdle Series Qualifier)
column20: 11/4 Pyleigh Master, 5/1 Idefix De Ciergues,  Getalead, 7/1 Love Of Neymore, 8/1 Kayf Dancer,  Jena d'Oudairies, 10/1 Queens Venture, 12/1 Champagne Chic, 25/1 Surrey Quest,  Classic Concorde, 33/1 Road Senam
column36: Returned from long absence with two disappointing runs for new stable this autumn
column37: Won over fences in France in autumn 2023 but returned from long absence with two disappointing hurdle runs (2m5f/3m) for new stable this autumn; others have much less to prove.

column4: Happy 21st Birthday Lori Garrett Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Stayers Hurdle Series Qualifier)
column20: 11/4 Pyleigh Master, 5/1 Idefix De Ciergues,  Getalead, 7/1 Love Of Neymore, 8/1 Kayf Dancer,  Jena d'Oudairies, 10/1 Queens Venture, 12/1 Champagne Chic, 25/1 Surrey Quest,  Classic Concorde, 33/1 Road Senam
column36: Won 2m3f maiden here in March but yet to build on that success; upped in trip here
column37: Justified skinny odds in 2m3f maiden here (good) in March but is yet to build on that performance and was behind Love Of Neymore when last of seven on seasonal debut at Wincanton (2m5f, good; first-time tongue-tie); upped in trip here; needs to raise her game.

column4: Coral Welsh Grand National Trial Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 9/4 Aworkinprogress, 4/1 Makin'yourmindup, 6/1 Minella Blueway, 7/1 Collectors Item,  Jubilee Express, 10/1 Stay Away Fay,  Pats Fancy, 16/1 Supervisor, 25/1 Sporting Ace
column36: Smart in his prime but pulled up on four of last five appearances
column37: Grade 1 novice hurdle winner who quickly developed into a smart novice chaser in 2023-24 season; pulled up on four of last five appearances, most recently in Grand National in April, and was given another wind op (his third) during the summer; leap of faith required to support him here.

column4: Coral Welsh Grand National Trial Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 9/4 Aworkinprogress, 4/1 Makin'yourmindup, 6/1 Minella Blueway, 7/1 Collectors Item,  Jubilee Express, 10/1 Stay Away Fay,  Pats Fancy, 16/1 Supervisor, 25/1 Sporting Ace
column36: Progress over fences in early 2024; returns from 615-day absence here
column37: Progressive over fences in early 2024, winning twice on heavy ground at Newbury (2m7f); not easy to weigh up after 615-day absence but on a good mark and the forecast faster ground won't be a problem; had summer wind op; might be worth chancing.

column4: Coral Welsh Grand National Trial Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 9/4 Aworkinprogress, 4/1 Makin'yourmindup, 6/1 Minella Blueway, 7/1 Collectors Item,  Jubilee Express, 10/1 Stay Away Fay,  Pats Fancy, 16/1 Supervisor, 25/1 Sporting Ace
column36: Thorough stayer; absent since April and needs to be in peak form to threaten off this mark
column37: Thorough stayer who gained last season's win in Somerset National at Wincanton (3m2f, good to soft); absent since April and will need to return in peak form to have any chance off current mark.

column4: Coral Welsh Grand National Trial Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 9/4 Aworkinprogress, 4/1 Makin'yourmindup, 6/1 Minella Blueway, 7/1 Collectors Item,  Jubilee Express, 10/1 Stay Away Fay,  Pats Fancy, 16/1 Supervisor, 25/1 Sporting Ace
column27: E A R L Haras De Montaigu
column36: Second in last season's Welsh National here; may find 2m7f on good to soft too sharp
column37: Now back on same mark as for commendable second in Welsh Grand National here (3m6f, soft) last December; not yet fully exposed over fences but was well beaten on both subsequent outings and may find 2m7f on good to soft too sharp (trainer reported last time that he wants further than 3m1f).

column4: Coral Welsh Grand National Trial Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 9/4 Aworkinprogress, 4/1 Makin'yourmindup, 6/1 Minella Blueway, 7/1 Collectors Item,  Jubilee Express, 10/1 Stay Away Fay,  Pats Fancy, 16/1 Supervisor, 25/1 Sporting Ace
column36: 5-5 over fences after last month's winning seasonal debut; up in grade here
column37: Made winning seasonal debut at Uttoxeter (3m2f, heavy) three weeks ago and is now 5-5 over fences; upped in grade here and not sure to be as effective on the less testing ground but we still don't know the limit of his ability.

column4: Coral Welsh Grand National Trial Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 9/4 Aworkinprogress, 4/1 Makin'yourmindup, 6/1 Minella Blueway, 7/1 Collectors Item,  Jubilee Express, 10/1 Stay Away Fay,  Pats Fancy, 16/1 Supervisor, 25/1 Sporting Ace
column36: 2-2 in cheekpieces at end of last season; pulled up in October but headgear now refitted
column37: 2-2 when fitted with cheekpieces for final two starts last season, the latter success in valuable novices' handicap at Uttoxeter (3m, good to soft); well beaten on reappearance at Cheltenham in October (no headgear) but could plausibly resume his progress now that the cheekpieces are back on.

column4: Coral Welsh Grand National Trial Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 9/4 Aworkinprogress, 4/1 Makin'yourmindup, 6/1 Minella Blueway, 7/1 Collectors Item,  Jubilee Express, 10/1 Stay Away Fay,  Pats Fancy, 16/1 Supervisor, 25/1 Sporting Ace
column36: Dual C&D winner in December 2021 but lighly raced and generally very disappointing since
column37: Dual C&D winner in December 2021 but lightly raced and generally very disappointing since; respectable fourth on seasonal debut at Ffos Las (3m1f, soft; first-time cheekpieces) in October but moves back up in grade here and younger rivals appeal more.

column4: Coral Welsh Grand National Trial Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 9/4 Aworkinprogress, 4/1 Makin'yourmindup, 6/1 Minella Blueway, 7/1 Collectors Item,  Jubilee Express, 10/1 Stay Away Fay,  Pats Fancy, 16/1 Supervisor, 25/1 Sporting Ace
column36: Back in the doldrums since winning Lingfield marathon in January; 3lb wrong; blinkers on
column37: Returned to form with narrow win in Surrey National at Lingfield (3m5f, heavy) in January but soundly beaten all three starts since, the latest over hurdles in refitted cheekpieces; reverts to chasing in first-time blinkers and competes from 3lb out of the weights.

column4: Coral Welsh Grand National Trial Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 9/4 Aworkinprogress, 4/1 Makin'yourmindup, 6/1 Minella Blueway, 7/1 Collectors Item,  Jubilee Express, 10/1 Stay Away Fay,  Pats Fancy, 16/1 Supervisor, 25/1 Sporting Ace
column32: Mrs Julia Young And Venetia Williams
column36: Kept on well for second at Ludlow in April but 7lb wrong on this seasonal debut
column37: 2-12 over fences; kept on well for second at Ludlow (3m, good to soft) in April but effectively 6lb higher from out of the weights in stronger race here, and this 11yo needs a career-best performance on his seasonal debut.

column4: DAGEM Power Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (For The See More Business Trophy) (GBB Race)
column20: 3/1 Willmount, 100/30 Elysian Knight, 4/1 Bective Abbey,  Alan De Banks, 10/1 Toss Of A Coin,  Ivaldi, 12/1 Felicie Du Maquis
column36: Seemed to be running well before falling on stable/chase debut; remains of interest
column37: Did not fulfill his potential over hurdles for Nicky Henderson but, following a layoff, seemed to be running well before falling at fourth-last fence on stable/chase debut at Ffos Las (2m3f, soft) last month; could still have a good future over fences.

column4: DAGEM Power Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (For The See More Business Trophy) (GBB Race)
column20: 3/1 Willmount, 100/30 Elysian Knight, 4/1 Bective Abbey,  Alan De Banks, 10/1 Toss Of A Coin,  Ivaldi, 12/1 Felicie Du Maquis
column27: Margaret Treacy On His Own Stables
column36: Went close on chase debut but pulled up twice since; makes stable debut after layoff
column37: Low-mileage 7yo who went close on chase debut for Paul Nicholls at Uttoxeter (3m, soft) just under a year ago; pulled up on next two outings (cheekpieces added last time) and makes stable debut after ten-month break (same owner); had wind op during the summer; consult the market for clues.

column4: DAGEM Power Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (For The See More Business Trophy) (GBB Race)
column20: 3/1 Willmount, 100/30 Elysian Knight, 4/1 Bective Abbey,  Alan De Banks, 10/1 Toss Of A Coin,  Ivaldi, 12/1 Felicie Du Maquis
column36: Disappointed on both hurdle starts last season; makes chase debut after another layoff
column37: Returned from long absence with two disappointing hurdle runs last season and makes chasing debut after another ten-month layoff; had wind op during the summer; current ability very hard to gauge.

column4: DAGEM Power Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (For The See More Business Trophy) (GBB Race)
column20: 3/1 Willmount, 100/30 Elysian Knight, 4/1 Bective Abbey,  Alan De Banks, 10/1 Toss Of A Coin,  Ivaldi, 12/1 Felicie Du Maquis
column36: Promising novice hurdlers last season; up in trip for chase debut; one to consider
column37: Won two novice hurdles last season (2m4f/2m5f) and signed off with creditable second in valuable novices' handicap at Plumpton (2m4f, good) in April; upped in trip for seasonal/chase debut; one to consider.

column4: DAGEM Power Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (For The See More Business Trophy) (GBB Race)
column20: 3/1 Willmount, 100/30 Elysian Knight, 4/1 Bective Abbey,  Alan De Banks, 10/1 Toss Of A Coin,  Ivaldi, 12/1 Felicie Du Maquis

column4: DAGEM Power Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (For The See More Business Trophy) (GBB Race)
column20: 3/1 Willmount, 100/30 Elysian Knight, 4/1 Bective Abbey,  Alan De Banks, 10/1 Toss Of A Coin,  Ivaldi, 12/1 Felicie Du Maquis
column36: Ran well in big-field Cheltenham hurdle last month; respected on return to fences
column37: Irish point winner with 2-5 strike-rate over hurdles; well held when second of four on chase debut at Southwell (3m, good) in June but very respectable sixth of 18 in competitive Cheltenham handicap hurdle (2m5f, soft) last month, after a break, and Nicky Henderson is evidently keen to switch him back to fences.

column4: DAGEM Power Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (For The See More Business Trophy) (GBB Race)
column20: 3/1 Willmount, 100/30 Elysian Knight, 4/1 Bective Abbey,  Alan De Banks, 10/1 Toss Of A Coin,  Ivaldi, 12/1 Felicie Du Maquis
column36: Absent since runner-up on handicap hurdle debut in January but still looks interesting
column37: Bumper winner who made the frame in all three hurdle races, most recently when second on handicap debut at Ffos Las (3m, soft) in January; makes chasing debut after 11-month absence but still looks interesting.

column4: DAGEM Power Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/5 Modern Man, 5/1 Matthias, 11/2 Grand Vendetta, 6/1 Brisky Dancer, 16/1 Crossgales King,  Crystello, 33/1 Eton Mes,  No Panic, 50/1 The Italian Fox, 66/1 Devilsrollthedice, 100/1 Blowers,  Getaway Sam,  Nancefordshore
column36: Tailed off in a point bumper in March; can only be watched on this rules debut
column37: Tailed off in a point bumper in March; can only be watched on this rules debut.

column4: DAGEM Power Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/5 Modern Man, 5/1 Matthias, 11/2 Grand Vendetta, 6/1 Brisky Dancer, 16/1 Crossgales King,  Crystello, 33/1 Eton Mes,  No Panic, 50/1 The Italian Fox, 66/1 Devilsrollthedice, 100/1 Blowers,  Getaway Sam,  Nancefordshore
column27: S C E A De Maulepaire Et Al
column36: Half-brother to connections' high-class jumper Al Dancer; respected on debut
column37: £165,000 2yo; ninth foal; half-brother to six winners including connections' high-class jumper Al Dancer, smart Irish jumper Gold Dancer and smart French jumper Tzar's Dancer; dam unraced; tongue tied on debut; with that pedigree, he needs a close look.

column4: DAGEM Power Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/5 Modern Man, 5/1 Matthias, 11/2 Grand Vendetta, 6/1 Brisky Dancer, 16/1 Crossgales King,  Crystello, 33/1 Eton Mes,  No Panic, 50/1 The Italian Fox, 66/1 Devilsrollthedice, 100/1 Blowers,  Getaway Sam,  Nancefordshore
column36: Showed ability in bumpers and his C&D hurdle debut was not without promise
column37: Showed significant ability in bumpers, most recently when sixth on seasonal/stable debut at Cheltenham (good) in October, and last month's C&D hurdle debut (good to soft) was more promising than eventual 72l defeat might suggest; considered each-way.

column4: DAGEM Power Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/5 Modern Man, 5/1 Matthias, 11/2 Grand Vendetta, 6/1 Brisky Dancer, 16/1 Crossgales King,  Crystello, 33/1 Eton Mes,  No Panic, 50/1 The Italian Fox, 66/1 Devilsrollthedice, 100/1 Blowers,  Getaway Sam,  Nancefordshore
column36: Ran well to a point when sixth on rules debut but needs improvement here
column37: Runner-up in good-ground Irish point in April and ran well to a point before weakening into sixth on stable/hurdle debut at Fontwell (2m1f, good to soft) last month; needs a good step forward here but that's possible.

column4: DAGEM Power Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/5 Modern Man, 5/1 Matthias, 11/2 Grand Vendetta, 6/1 Brisky Dancer, 16/1 Crossgales King,  Crystello, 33/1 Eton Mes,  No Panic, 50/1 The Italian Fox, 66/1 Devilsrollthedice, 100/1 Blowers,  Getaway Sam,  Nancefordshore
column36: Remote when fourth of seven over C&D on recent rules debut
column37: Made the frame in two Irish points in spring but was remote when fourth of seven over C&D (soft) on rules debut a fortnight ago.

column4: DAGEM Power Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/5 Modern Man, 5/1 Matthias, 11/2 Grand Vendetta, 6/1 Brisky Dancer, 16/1 Crossgales King,  Crystello, 33/1 Eton Mes,  No Panic, 50/1 The Italian Fox, 66/1 Devilsrollthedice, 100/1 Blowers,  Getaway Sam,  Nancefordshore
column36: Placed in first of his three bumpers; improvement required on hurdling debut
column37: Placed in soft-ground Exeter bumper for Rod Millman in January but both subsequent bumper runs for David Pipe were somewhat underwhelming; improvement required on hurdle debut.

column4: DAGEM Power Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/5 Modern Man, 5/1 Matthias, 11/2 Grand Vendetta, 6/1 Brisky Dancer, 16/1 Crossgales King,  Crystello, 33/1 Eton Mes,  No Panic, 50/1 The Italian Fox, 66/1 Devilsrollthedice, 100/1 Blowers,  Getaway Sam,  Nancefordshore
column36: Well-beaten 80-1 shot over 2m here last month; tries a new trip today
column37: Unseated rider at first flight on stable/hurdle debut in October and was well-beaten 80-1 shot here (2m, soft) last month.

column4: DAGEM Power Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/5 Modern Man, 5/1 Matthias, 11/2 Grand Vendetta, 6/1 Brisky Dancer, 16/1 Crossgales King,  Crystello, 33/1 Eton Mes,  No Panic, 50/1 The Italian Fox, 66/1 Devilsrollthedice, 100/1 Blowers,  Getaway Sam,  Nancefordshore
column36: Well-bred newcomer from a top stable; interesting to see how he fares
column37: 140,000euros 3yo; seventh foal; half-brother to six winners including Lady Adare (useful bumper/jumps) and useful hurdlers Saint Bibiana and Sabrina; dam French hurdle winner; represents top stable; interesting newcomer.

column4: DAGEM Power Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/5 Modern Man, 5/1 Matthias, 11/2 Grand Vendetta, 6/1 Brisky Dancer, 16/1 Crossgales King,  Crystello, 33/1 Eton Mes,  No Panic, 50/1 The Italian Fox, 66/1 Devilsrollthedice, 100/1 Blowers,  Getaway Sam,  Nancefordshore
column36: Makes hurdle debut after two-year absence but looked promising in bumpers
column37: Made the frame in two bumpers towards end of 2023, more notably when second to very useful rival at Exeter (soft); makes hurdle debut after two-year absence but good market support will make him of strong interest.

column4: DAGEM Power Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/5 Modern Man, 5/1 Matthias, 11/2 Grand Vendetta, 6/1 Brisky Dancer, 16/1 Crossgales King,  Crystello, 33/1 Eton Mes,  No Panic, 50/1 The Italian Fox, 66/1 Devilsrollthedice, 100/1 Blowers,  Getaway Sam,  Nancefordshore
column36: Irish point winner who made pleasing start to rules career when third over C&D last month
column37: Irish point winner who is a half-brother to smart hurdler Gwennie May Boy and made pleasing start to rules career when third over C&D (good to soft) last month; that form sets a clear standard here and he has very obvious scope for progress.

column4: DAGEM Power Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/5 Modern Man, 5/1 Matthias, 11/2 Grand Vendetta, 6/1 Brisky Dancer, 16/1 Crossgales King,  Crystello, 33/1 Eton Mes,  No Panic, 50/1 The Italian Fox, 66/1 Devilsrollthedice, 100/1 Blowers,  Getaway Sam,  Nancefordshore
column36: Pulled up in two Irish points in the spring; can't be recommended on rules debut
column37: Pulled up in two Irish points in the spring; can't be recommended on rules debut.

column4: DAGEM Power Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/5 Modern Man, 5/1 Matthias, 11/2 Grand Vendetta, 6/1 Brisky Dancer, 16/1 Crossgales King,  Crystello, 33/1 Eton Mes,  No Panic, 50/1 The Italian Fox, 66/1 Devilsrollthedice, 100/1 Blowers,  Getaway Sam,  Nancefordshore
column36: Shaped quite well when sixth on recent hurdle debut but others look stronger here
column37: Shaped quite well before weakening into sixth of 12 on recent seasonal/hurdle debut at Exeter (2m, good to soft) but others have much stronger claims here.

column4: DAGEM Power Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/5 Modern Man, 5/1 Matthias, 11/2 Grand Vendetta, 6/1 Brisky Dancer, 16/1 Crossgales King,  Crystello, 33/1 Eton Mes,  No Panic, 50/1 The Italian Fox, 66/1 Devilsrollthedice, 100/1 Blowers,  Getaway Sam,  Nancefordshore

column4: Coral Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)

column36: £40,000 3yo; yard 1-40 in bumpers in recent years and he could be a longer-term prospect
column37: £40,000 3yo; fourth foal; dam well held completed hurdles start in France, half-sister to winners Fleur De La Roque (2m1f hurdles), Isabella Bee (2m-2m3f hurdle/chase) and Dancing Roque (1m7f/2m1f hurdle), out of useful 1m4f Flat/2m1f hurdle winner; yard 1-40 in bumpers in recent years and he could be a longer-term prospect.

column4: Coral Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
column20: 6/4 Presley, 11/4 Princess Day, 11/2 Keltype, 15/2 Viva Vincente, 9/1 The Lightmaker, 10/1 Midnight Doyen, 25/1 Winters Hill, 50/1 Maria's Joy

column4: Coral Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
column20: 6/4 Presley, 11/4 Princess Day, 11/2 Keltype, 15/2 Viva Vincente, 9/1 The Lightmaker, 10/1 Midnight Doyen, 25/1 Winters Hill, 50/1 Maria's Joy
column36: Has speed and stamina in pedigree and market should guide on debut
column37: 11,500euros foal, £24,000 3yo; half-brother to winners Born To Honour (French 2m1f hurdle/2m2f chase) and Lady Gavoi (Italian 5f-1m1f); dam 8.4f 2yo winner (RPR 76), half-sister to useful 1m/1m4f winner Burren Quality; has speed and stamina in pedigree and market should guide on debut.

column4: Coral Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
column20: 6/4 Presley, 11/4 Princess Day, 11/2 Keltype, 15/2 Viva Vincente, 9/1 The Lightmaker, 10/1 Midnight Doyen, 25/1 Winters Hill, 50/1 Maria's Joy
column36: Plenty to like on paper and interesting to see how he figures in market
column37: 3,000euros 3yo; fourth foal; half-brother to useful bumper and 3m/3m1f chase winner Autonomous Cloud; dam 2m-2m1f hurdle/chase winner, half-sister to smart 2m-2m4f hurdle/chase winner Gala Ball, out of sister to top-class 2m-2m5f chase winner Voy Por Ustedes; plenty to like on paper and interesting to see how he figures in market.

column4: Coral Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
column20: 6/4 Presley, 11/4 Princess Day, 11/2 Keltype, 15/2 Viva Vincente, 9/1 The Lightmaker, 10/1 Midnight Doyen, 25/1 Winters Hill, 50/1 Maria's Joy

column37: Point-to-point winner; smooth winner of a Down Royal bumper on rules debut last season; third behind a stablemate in a five-runner Listed contest bumper at this venue a year ago; made all for an easy maiden hurdle win over C&D last month; deserted by Jack Kennedy.

column4: Tote Guarantee, Never Beaten By SP Navan Novice Hurdle (Grade 2)

column37: Useful (124-rated) hurdler has a similar rating after three runs over fences earlier in the season; this is a much hotter beginners' chase however so plenty on his plate.

column20: 13/8 Slade Steel, 11/4 Kopeck De Mee, 4/1 Wingmen, 8/1 Predators Gold, 12/1 Karl Des Tourelles, 16/1 Ballybow, 33/1 Born Braver,  Great Universe,  My Trump Card,  Park Of Kings,  Uncle Pat,  Win Some Lose Some, 50/1 Butter Fingers, 66/1 Dont Tell Jack,  Mywayofthinkin, 200/1 Angels Halo
column36: Poor effort (jumped left) over C&D last month; others hold stronger claims
column37: Won the Pertemps qualifier at Leopardstown last Christmas but was only eighth in the final at Cheltenham when behind Karl Des Tourelles who was giving him weight; promising chase debut third at Galway in October but poor effort (jumped left) over C&D last month; others hold stronger claims.

column4: Watch Danny's Diary @ToteRacing Beginners Chase
column20: 13/8 Slade Steel, 11/4 Kopeck De Mee, 4/1 Wingmen, 8/1 Predators Gold, 12/1 Karl Des Tourelles, 16/1 Ballybow, 33/1 Born Braver,  Great Universe,  My Trump Card,  Park Of Kings,  Uncle Pat,  Win Some Lose Some, 50/1 Butter Fingers, 66/1 Dont Tell Jack,  Mywayofthinkin, 200/1 Angels Halo
column36: Last month's C&D second to Final Demand makes him a major player
column37: Never added to his maiden hurdle win here last season although quite smart level of form in Graded novices; promising C&D chase debut last month when chasing home the high-class Final Demand, putting it up to the winner until mistake last when tiring (well ahead of several of today's rivals); granted normal improvement looks one to feature here.

column4: Watch Danny's Diary @ToteRacing Beginners Chase
column20: 13/8 Slade Steel, 11/4 Kopeck De Mee, 4/1 Wingmen, 8/1 Predators Gold, 12/1 Karl Des Tourelles, 16/1 Ballybow, 33/1 Born Braver,  Great Universe,  My Trump Card,  Park Of Kings,  Uncle Pat,  Win Some Lose Some, 50/1 Butter Fingers, 66/1 Dont Tell Jack,  Mywayofthinkin, 200/1 Angels Halo
column36: Low-grade hurdler impossible to fancy on chase debut
column37: Low-grade hurdler impossible to fancy on chase debut.

column4: Watch Danny's Diary @ToteRacing Beginners Chase
column20: 13/8 Slade Steel, 11/4 Kopeck De Mee, 4/1 Wingmen, 8/1 Predators Gold, 12/1 Karl Des Tourelles, 16/1 Ballybow, 33/1 Born Braver,  Great Universe,  My Trump Card,  Park Of Kings,  Uncle Pat,  Win Some Lose Some, 50/1 Butter Fingers, 66/1 Dont Tell Jack,  Mywayofthinkin, 200/1 Angels Halo
column36: 4yo faces much hotter opposition than of late so hard to fancy
column37: 110-rated hurdler unseated on chase debut at Wexford and didn't feature at Gowran; of limited appeal in a much hotter race.

column4: Tote Always SP Or Better INH Flat Race
column19: Given a favourable mention by Gordon Elliott in a recent Racing Post stable tour, WITH NOLIMIT may well be ready to strike on debut
column20: 11/10 With Nolimit, 100/30 Fixios, 11/2 Detroit Maverick, 13/2 Treasure Memory, 15/2 Gillane, 12/1 Native Deal, 25/1 Touch The Clouds, 33/1 Royal Soldier, 50/1 Charismatic Kid,  Clash Gold
column32: John G Hayes & A M Ryan & James Woods
column36: Half-brother to winning hurdler/chasers Lazer Wolf & Bilbo Bagins; market best guide
column37: Affinisea 4yo cost 14,000euros as a foal and 24,000GBP as a 3yo; half-brother to winners Lazer Wolf (2m hurdle/2m2f chase) and Bilbo Bagins (2m1f-2m4f hurdle/chase); dam unraced, out of half-sister to useful 2m4f/2m5f hurdle/chase winner Truth Be Told; market best guide on debut.

column4: Tote Always SP Or Better INH Flat Race
column19: Given a favourable mention by Gordon Elliott in a recent Racing Post stable tour, WITH NOLIMIT may well be ready to strike on debut
column20: 11/10 With Nolimit, 100/30 Fixios, 11/2 Detroit Maverick, 13/2 Treasure Memory, 15/2 Gillane, 12/1 Native Deal, 25/1 Touch The Clouds, 33/1 Royal Soldier, 50/1 Charismatic Kid,  Clash Gold
column36: Ballyknock points' winner for Colin Bowe; obvious appeal from top yard
column37: Flemensfirth 5yo cost 48,000euros as a foal and 82,000euros as a 3yo; fourth foal; dam maiden half-sister to 2m3f/2m5f hurdle winner Last Of The Bunch (dam of Champion Bumper winner Relegate), family of smart staying jumper Better Times Ahead; successful at third attempt in point-to-points for Colin Bowe in Ballyknock maiden in April (good-to-yielding); obvious appeal from top yard, maket best guide of two for the yard.

column4: Tote Always SP Or Better INH Flat Race
column19: Given a favourable mention by Gordon Elliott in a recent Racing Post stable tour, WITH NOLIMIT may well be ready to strike on debut
column20: 11/10 With Nolimit, 100/30 Fixios, 11/2 Detroit Maverick, 13/2 Treasure Memory, 15/2 Gillane, 12/1 Native Deal, 25/1 Touch The Clouds, 33/1 Royal Soldier, 50/1 Charismatic Kid,  Clash Gold
column36: Promising debut third in maiden hurdle here last month; respected
column37: Maxios half-brother to point-to-point winners Paloma Dove and Largy Fix; dam unraced half-sister to useful bumper and 2m-2m4f hurdle/chase winner Jim Will Fix It; far outran his 100-1 odds on debut here last month in 2m4f Navan maiden hurdle, staying on late into third (having hit the last) behind an odds-on stablemate of With Nolimit; has to be respected here switching to bumper.

column4: Tote Always SP Or Better INH Flat Race
column19: Given a favourable mention by Gordon Elliott in a recent Racing Post stable tour, WITH NOLIMIT may well be ready to strike on debut
column20: 11/10 With Nolimit, 100/30 Fixios, 11/2 Detroit Maverick, 13/2 Treasure Memory, 15/2 Gillane, 12/1 Native Deal, 25/1 Touch The Clouds, 33/1 Royal Soldier, 50/1 Charismatic Kid,  Clash Gold
column36: Definite ability in Gowran maiden hurdles; respected back in a bumper here
column37: Runner-up in a point-to-point and best runs on track in 2m Gowran maiden hurdles, none too fluent when third in January and after 10 months' absence creditable fifth of 20 last month (heavy); reverts to bumper here.

column4: Tote Always SP Or Better INH Flat Race
column19: Given a favourable mention by Gordon Elliott in a recent Racing Post stable tour, WITH NOLIMIT may well be ready to strike on debut
column20: 11/10 With Nolimit, 100/30 Fixios, 11/2 Detroit Maverick, 13/2 Treasure Memory, 15/2 Gillane, 12/1 Native Deal, 25/1 Touch The Clouds, 33/1 Royal Soldier, 50/1 Charismatic Kid,  Clash Gold
column36: Didn't go unbacked when never dangerous fifth on Down Royal debut in May; may need this
column37: Bred by Godolphin and bought for 13,500GBP as 3yo; brother to 7f-9.5f winner Laser Show (inc 2yo/UAE dirt;), half-brother to French 5.5f-8.5f winner Egot (inc 2yo/AW/Group 3); dam Australian Group-placed 6.7f-1m1f winner; didn't go unbacked when never dangerous fifth of 12 on Down Royal debut in May on quicker ground; may need this.

column4: Tote Always SP Or Better INH Flat Race
column19: Given a favourable mention by Gordon Elliott in a recent Racing Post stable tour, WITH NOLIMIT may well be ready to strike on debut
column20: 11/10 With Nolimit, 100/30 Fixios, 11/2 Detroit Maverick, 13/2 Treasure Memory, 15/2 Gillane, 12/1 Native Deal, 25/1 Touch The Clouds, 33/1 Royal Soldier, 50/1 Charismatic Kid,  Clash Gold
column36: Some promise before pulled up on points' debut in May; market best guide on rules debut
column37: Soldier Of Fortune 5yo cost 23,000euros as a foal; brother to bumper winner Soldier In Milan, half-brother to winners Western Ruler (2m hurdle) and Time To Rocco (bumper and 2m2f chase/2m4f hurdle); unraced dam closely related to Grand National second Oscar Time; some promise before pulled up on point-to-point debut at Stowlin in May; market best guide on rules debut.

column4: Tote Always SP Or Better INH Flat Race
column19: Given a favourable mention by Gordon Elliott in a recent Racing Post stable tour, WITH NOLIMIT may well be ready to strike on debut
column20: 11/10 With Nolimit, 100/30 Fixios, 11/2 Detroit Maverick, 13/2 Treasure Memory, 15/2 Gillane, 12/1 Native Deal, 25/1 Touch The Clouds, 33/1 Royal Soldier, 50/1 Charismatic Kid,  Clash Gold
column36: Half-brother to 2m5f/3m hurdle winner Shotgun Jack; market likely best guide on debut
column37: Maxios half-brother to 2m5f/3m hurdle winner Shotgun Jack; dam 2m-2m4f hurdle/chase winner, out of half-sister to smart 2m4f-3m1f hurdle/chase winner My Old Gold; another debutant for whom market likely best guide.

column4: Tote Always SP Or Better INH Flat Race
column19: Given a favourable mention by Gordon Elliott in a recent Racing Post stable tour, WITH NOLIMIT may well be ready to strike on debut
column20: 11/10 With Nolimit, 100/30 Fixios, 11/2 Detroit Maverick, 13/2 Treasure Memory, 15/2 Gillane, 12/1 Native Deal, 25/1 Touch The Clouds, 33/1 Royal Soldier, 50/1 Charismatic Kid,  Clash Gold
column36: Punchestown third a contender but possibly vulnerable to one with a superior turn of foot
column37: Half-brother to 2m/2m3f chase winner Valirann Gold; dam unraced half-sister to smart bumper and 2m-3m hurdle winner Make Your Mark; point-to-point second ran well on rules debut to finish third in 2m Galway maiden hurdle in October (yielding) and last month solid third of 6 in Punchestown bumper, staying on without troubling front two; definite contender but possibly vulnerable to one with a superior turn of foot.

column4: Tote Always SP Or Better INH Flat Race
column19: Given a favourable mention by Gordon Elliott in a recent Racing Post stable tour, WITH NOLIMIT may well be ready to strike on debut
column20: 11/10 With Nolimit, 100/30 Fixios, 11/2 Detroit Maverick, 13/2 Treasure Memory, 15/2 Gillane, 12/1 Native Deal, 25/1 Touch The Clouds, 33/1 Royal Soldier, 50/1 Charismatic Kid,  Clash Gold
column36: Points' winner withdrawn at Down Royal last month but could be up to winning on debut
column37: Hacked up in a Liscarroll point-to-point (3m, yielding) in March and bought for 250,000GBP at the Aintree sales in April; dam closely related to Welsh National winner Le Beau Bai so will probably want further than this in time but received favourable reviews in recent Racing Post stable tour and could be ready to play a big role on bumper debut.

column4: Tote Always SP Or Better INH Flat Race
column19: Given a favourable mention by Gordon Elliott in a recent Racing Post stable tour, WITH NOLIMIT may well be ready to strike on debut
column20: 11/10 With Nolimit, 100/30 Fixios, 11/2 Detroit Maverick, 13/2 Treasure Memory, 15/2 Gillane, 12/1 Native Deal, 25/1 Touch The Clouds, 33/1 Royal Soldier, 50/1 Charismatic Kid,  Clash Gold
column36: Well held on debut in good-class Punchestown bumper a year ago; can only be watched
column37: Daughter of Affinisea is a first foal; dam unraced half-sister to 2m7f/3m5f chase winner Movethechains; well held on debut in good-class Punchestown bumper a year ago for Stephen Ryan; can only be watched on return.
